prop.head.headtext: Handling Cases Before the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation

head.headtext: Factors considered by the Panel—Selection factors generally

para.paratext: The primary goal of the Panel in selecting a transferee judge is to implement the purposes of transfer under the statute. The Panel will prefer a judge who is experienced with the particular litigation because it knows that a judge in that position is best able to manage the cases effectively and is able to do so with minimal disruption to his or her remaining caseload. Selection of such a judge maximizes the benefits of transfer and reduces or minimizes the burdens transfer imposes on the transferee judge.

More than any other decision made by the Panel, this is a decision in which attorneys for the parties have little input. Additionally, little is usually said in the Panel decisions regarding reasons for selecting a particular judge. It is probable that some judges lobby the Panel members either to receive or not to receive Panel transfer assignments. Consents to transfer are obtained before a formal transfer is ordered, so there is undoubtedly opportunity for the Panel to consider the informal preferences of potential transferee judges.
Maslon Edelman Borman & Brand, LLP, Minneapolis, Minnesota.
